lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: And Matthew Mercer! (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like this chair is really low.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Do we have any phone books you could sit on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Get a Comic Con booster seat. It'll be good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Excuse me.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: We'll get one requested for next year.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is like an elementary school chair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is very-- yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like I need a booster.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel like I need a desk in front of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello, everyone!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hello! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can I just say how happy I am that this many people came out to join us on the godawful early 10:30AM on a Saturday at Comic Con? That's amazing! (cheering)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yes. I agree. Well, we're going to talk a little bit about the recent events of Critical Role, we're going to talk a little bit about-- we have a couple announcements, and then we're going to take your guys' questions. I'll tell you when to line up in just a minute. But first, Matt, I think there's a pretty big announcement that we were saving for San Diego Comic Con, if you want to fill everybody in on what that might be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glad you guys could be here for this.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, man!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, I was just hype-manning you. Yeah! What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're starting with big reveals already?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yes, Sam! The people have waited!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Aren't we supposed to wait to build tension or--

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm surprised we made it to this room.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Besides, people leave at the end of panels. We all know this. They want to get to Game of Thrones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want to sit on it any more, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can finally talk about it, Colville, you're good. He's penning it, he's the actual words. And then to find the artist for it, one of our big things about Critical Role is to try to find a way to lift the community and help get people the opportunities that they deserve for this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Yeah, I'm really excited about it. A lot of splash pages.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: If you saw Tary's art, you know what you're in for. Save your money.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, Matt, go on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one we kept coming to is an artist named Olivia Samson in the Critical Role art community, and she has agreed to be the artist for the first six-issue run. We have a couple examples here we can show you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reveal! Reveal! Reveal!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here's some of the early lineart that she's done. It takes place in Stillben in the surrounding K'Tawl Swamp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I recognize those half-elves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have a couple pages where we can show the progression of some of the early art design and coloring. Over on the next page. There we go. Show some of the later--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Eyeballs!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't give away too much!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, this is just a couple pages, don't worry. Then we go to the next one. One of the early color layouts there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vax is the one with the bow and arrow, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's the one. Then we move onto the actual character art layouts that she had done for some of the designs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Big reveal! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're excited to give you guys this first look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We were going to call it Vox Machina Assemble, but apparently that's already taken. So still working on the name.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Matt, is there a release date announced, or a window in which it will be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That information is to come soon.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I'm asking on behalf of the audience.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (British accent) On behalf?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (British accent) On behalf of the audience who will be tweeting us the same question for the next six months.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I understand. We will have that information official to you as soon as possible. I guarantee you at least you'll see something in your hands by the end of the year.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Well, in an orderly fashion, if some of you want to line up for questions, we're going to start taking those in a minute. Orderly! Love each other! Respect, love each other! Oh my god, is that donuts?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're loaded with LSD. Do not eat them! We'll be tripping balls.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Denise, get this girl a car.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is my favorite panel!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, we got a Pike over here. Who wants a donut?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: While you guys are lining up--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, bring them back! Hey, man, come on!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: You know better than to do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And bye, box of donuts. I love you!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: You're awesome. What's your name? Kiana? That's a beautiful name. While you guys are thinking of your questions, Sam and I were talking before the show and there's actually a couple other big reveals that we wanted to announce at this Comic Con panel. First of all, season three of Critical Role has already been written and you guys are going to love it. We were in the hotel room this morning going over episodes 200 and whatever and it was, my god! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One of the big reveals-- Matt is going to reveal that Victor, beloved character Victor, he just had lead poisoning. He gets treatment and he's totally normal now.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: What would that sound like, Matt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Victor voice) I apologize if it's been at all difficult to have made a fool of myself in a public venue. However, I am happy to sell any sort of black powder to you if you come by my place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Love the new twist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Still very charming.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Sam, some of the upcoming guests for Critical Role coming up in season three: the current and former cast of The View, including, it says here on the card, Star Jones and some of the Dance Moms.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Excited about that.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Once you have Jon Heder, you can get anybody.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The world opens up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all downhill from there.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To each other. Boom!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: And finally, it says Liam and Sam are now legally separated in real life.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because he married his sister, so.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (laughs) He did, he did. Okay, let's take some questions. Go ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You said you were cool with anything.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Tell us your name, please.

lines.name: ANDI
lines.text: Hi, my name is Andi--

lines.name: MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: Hi Andi!

lines.name: ANDI
lines.text: Hi! So Brian I took the day off today, so I'm not working this time.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, was that you at Wondercon?

lines.name: ANDI
lines.text: Yeah. My mom's sitting right there.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Aww, hey, mom! That's awesome. She was working and couldn't come to the last Wondercon panel, so I told her I would go to your work and say hi and I got lost on the way. Thank you for coming. What's your question?

lines.name: ANDI
lines.text: My question is for everybody. What's been your favorite story arc so far? (thinking noises)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Going through the 500 hours that we've--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that an arc, or--

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: That's not an arc, but that's the right answer!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a lot of math on it online.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might be a straight line--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: More of a parabola--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe the lack of arc was the problem.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought the joke would break my fall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was sick for cows, so I got to sit at home with a fever and watch the cow episode and be like, (loopy voice) This is so nice! I like this! It's great!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't believe you weren't there for the cow episode!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know, I've been like retconned into it--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) That's right! There was that fanart!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: None of you ever remember.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was that fanart where we all come back as cows and Percy's like, what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody was like, remember when we did that? And I was like, I didn't do that. And you're like, yeah remember when we all did that, and like, fuck-- (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did you go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, there's no--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a free-for-all.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I really liked the Briarwood arc. I really did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I have to answer too? The one we're on right now is pretty cool, because we get to hang out with gods and stuff-- no spoilers. But yeah, it's interesting. I have no idea what's going to happen because I barely know how D&D works.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: We love you, Darin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Darin De Paul in the house! Yeah, Sprigg's amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (ominous voice) It's a shame he has to die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Matthew!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Not cool, dude.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I liked the visit to the Nine Hells.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a fun one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that was great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you very much.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Who's next?

lines.name: MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: (gasping) Lucy!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're awesome.

lines.name: LUCY
lines.text: There's a 5th-level druid spell called Reincarnation, and if Pike wasn't around and you guys had to be reincarnated, which means you come back with your memories but you have a different body, what would you like your character to be reincarnated as?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What we would like them to be?

lines.name: LUCY
lines.text: Ideally.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we don't get to choose, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. But if you

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LUCY
lines.text: For Matt, if there's an NPC that you would prefer to die and be reincarnated--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's more old-school D&D, because back then you could return them back as an animal, which was fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can come back as animals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In older editions, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's cool. I don't know. I would like to come back as a half-celestial. Can you do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is an aasimar, that's the two boys that you met--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I want. I want blue hair, man. Slightly blue skin and blue hair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why go off-brand? What are they called, kuatoa? What are the little bird folk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The frog guys?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, the birds-- the little raven or were-raven--

lines.name: AUDIENCE
lines.text: Kenku!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kenku! Thank you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's perfect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm now envisioning Vax as Bird Person from Rick and Morty. "Hi. Dagger dagger dagger."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There are four more, keep going.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (George Takei voice) Hello.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spoiler, we're replacing Sam with George Takei.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (George Takei voice) Oh my.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (George Takei voice) Bigby's Hand.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: That's really good!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like Pike would probably come back as an otter, or something and be like, oh no. That wasn't the plan. I was thinking like a regular-sized whatever. I think I could be a little bit taller, sometimes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The second coming of Vox Machina rises out of the water right in the middle, an otter pokes up a head.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no! I'm even shorter now!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I love the idea of, completely random, but the whole notion of coming back as a pixie, just a teeny tiny, dammit Na'vi level of (nyoom noises).

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pixies!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, the indignation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'd be all about a half-orc Keyleth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Chicken it is, all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, that sounds about right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is that when he retires from adventuring? (Grog voice) I'm good!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plenty of things to do!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let me know when you get back!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: All right. Did everybody answer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aww, that's going to happen now? You put that into the world!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: All right, you artists that I call upon for the really twisted shit, you know who you are. And I will say, go! Do it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go Tess go! Go, do it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In canon, the Titanstone Pasties do have tassels.

lines.name: LUCY
lines.text: I am both sorry and very much not sorry for starting this.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: No, you did good. Make sure to see Denise after and get a Free Denise pen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to rage.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hey, what's your name?

lines.name: ELEVATORGUY
lines.text: Elevator Guy.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Elevator Guy! That's a terrible name, but I'm not going to judge your parents.

lines.name: ELEVATORGUY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You broke Laura!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Do the impression! Do the impression, Liam!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bilbo Baggins.

lines.name: ELEVATORGUY
lines.text: So in Sam and Liam's podcast, Liam, you mentioned that you went to NYU, and, well, I'm going in the fall for the first time, and Ashley, you live in New York a lot of the time, so I was wondering if you guys had any tips for a first-time New Yorker.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tips for a first-time New Yorker?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Get used to the smell of pee.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Obviously go to Central Park.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't make eye contact with anyone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, when are you going?

lines.name: ELEVATORGUY
lines.text: August 25.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so if you go into Central Park almost when it's dark, which I know sounds a little sketchy, there are so many fireflies, so that would be really cool.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: This is-- no. Two seconds of googling, you'll see, there are no fireflies.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Behind the boathouse. Come alone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a big mermaid festival on Coney Island I think that's coming up. Super cool.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's at Coney Island.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is Bryant Park still doing the summer movie festivals where you can do free movies? New York's amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: When we were in New York last, all of us, we went to Chelsea Piers, and we all did a golf driving range together, and we were terrible.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can see most shows on Broadway for free by volunteering to usher.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or by sneaking in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or by being a student. Flash that student ID card everywhere.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. And go to Di Fara Pizza in Brooklyn for a Grandma Slice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're writing all this down, right?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, watch Tuesday night with a notepad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The next three questions of mine are, what's there to do in Cincinnati? What part of West Hollywood should I live in?

lines.name: ELEVATORGUY
lines.text: All right. Thank you very much.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you, man, that was great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's our next book release, is Vox Machina's guide to travel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, that would be great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tyriok's guide?

lines.name: MICHELLE
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hello. What's your name?

lines.name: MICHELLE
lines.text: I'm Michelle.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Hi, Michelle.

lines.name: MICHELLE
lines.text: Hi. So my question is, if you have to do a trial by combat, and can only pick one other ally, and that can include guest characters, who would you summon and why?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like, across all universes or in ours?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, it's an hour panel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, I need a question clarification. Is this all of us as Vox Machina doing a trial by combat and then summoning one ally, or each individually?

lines.name: MICHELLE
lines.text: Each individually.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we pick Pelor, like, the Dawnfather?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Player character, motherfucker, player character.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to pick the character of Noelle Stevenson as Tova. Oh, wait, she's right over there in the audience!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: This is an all-star panel.

lines.name: AUDIENCE
lines.text: If she's still alive!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, she's totally dead. Totally dead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You hush your mouth! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think, based on our last Battle Royale, and me and you going toe-to-toe, it'd be me and you to the end, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Word.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'd be terrible to take on. We'd never die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's true. I'd pick the werewolf, because as soon as he started to die, I'd be like, bite me, dude. Just bite me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, everybody should pick Keyleth. She's the most powerful character in the group.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But only with allies that we've traveled with. Not Vox Machina.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not Vox Machina? Keyleth would be a great ally. No. Come back to me, then.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Allura.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do they have to be a friend? Could they have been an enemy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But is it a trial by fisticuffs?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, we are way overcomplicating this. We are overthinking this way too much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just need to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're just like this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, part of me would like to run with Delilah Briarwood. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like Vex is getting close to that anyways, so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You just keep healing me, we'll just keep smashing them? Yeah. Like Overwatch tag-team.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome, thank you so much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This makes me want an Injustice Critical Role DLC.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got like a third of it already.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be awesome.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hey, what's your name?

lines.name: BRETT
lines.text: My name is Brett.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRETT
lines.text: So my question is, if you could replace your player character with any NPC, which one would you play?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Similar, but different question.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Victor. Yeah, Victor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would go Gilmore super-fast. So much fun. (Gilmore voice) I just love doing that voice all the time. Hello.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would go with Jarett, because he's so dreamy and hunky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is so dreamy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (Jarett voice) Hello.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kitten's worth of hit points.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (illusory beholder voice) Hah! I used to do Broadway! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Next question.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: All right, that's good, thank you. What's your name?

lines.name: JUSTIN
lines.text: Justin.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Hi, Justin.

lines.name: JUSTIN
lines.text: Hi. So my home D&D group also happens to include a lot of stage and improv actors from the Boston area, and so I take a lot of inspiration from what you guys do, and I'm wondering, for any of you, the whole approach or the headspace you're in to do Critical Role, does it have any relationship to what you would do or how you would approach a stage role or an improv, scripted role? Is there a relation, or is it totally different?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah. Some of us were talking in the green room before coming out here right before the show started. I spent years in the theater, and it's been ten years since my last one, and three years ago, I was like, "Man, I'm getting really itchy, I've got to get back on stage." And that's gone. This scratches that itch so much. And we're living in a role for five years? Is it five years?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, in a weird way, it feels like the longest longform improv.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like the preparation for it can be very similar. I feel like we slid our way into our backstories and everything like that. We had loose ideas of what it was before we started playing a lot, but when you're starting a new role in a theater show-- what am I talking about? Then yeah, you would do the same thing, you would establish all of those ties in your mind, and you would figure out what is their favorite music to listen to, and what kind of food do they like, and all that kind of stuff, and it's the same stuff you do with this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it's good for the drive over, you really get the headspace.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Let the bodies hit the lava. Is that on your playlist?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just rage and death and destruction.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is it, C is for Cookie? That was one year?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, cute!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome, thank you so much.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you very much. Hey, what's your name?

lines.name: DAVID
lines.text: Hi, I'm David, hi, hello. My question is for world-famous podcasters Sam Riegel and Liam O'Brien.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, yeah.

lines.name: DAVID
lines.text: Can we expect another episode of All Work No Play within the next three years?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, can we?! Please?! I want it!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Three years, you can make that happen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get married all over again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're averaging about two a year these days.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, we talk about doing it like 12 times a year. So that's got to count for something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not true. I told you a bajillion times we would just do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've told you a bajillion times we would do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You won't even invite me on Signal Boost.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, that is-- there is video evidence that that's bullshit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gaslighter!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sam Riegel will be dead in under an hour.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No more All Work No Play. Yeah, we have one planned, because we're going to do a live episode soon, in a couple weeks, and then maybe we'll do it where we're going to go into somebody's hot tub to record an episode.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we've been threatening to return to the hot tub.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, do you have a hot tub?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a hot tub.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you were already a guest on the show.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, can we go in your hot tub and bring a stranger to interview? (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thanks for the question.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: GABBY
lines.text: And my question is, due to everything that has been going on with your characters, everything that's been going on, I was wondering what your characters are grateful for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are your characters grateful for?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And my buddy Pike. And my friends. Also, ale.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Currently--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, Kiki.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just tears.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth is-- she hasn't said it out loud in-game yet, but she will, but she's thankful for being taught how to love by a certain rogue.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Definitely grateful for family at the moment, is Percy's bag right now. He's feeling good, all things considered.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your family's weird, though.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know! That's why I appreciate the friends that you've made into your family, because the Trickfoots, as we know, are so terrible. And also, I think being able to see Sarenrae, the Everlight, in person, I think that's opened up something else in Pike, and what else?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Technically via Skype.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Via Skype, but still.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think Scanlan values being accepted back into the group. That's about it. And Kaylie.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I mean, I've got to go with the boots, right? I've got to go with the boots. I got my boots back. Our long national nightmare is finally over.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, boy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was never going to keep them! Until he's dead, and then they're mine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All of us are grateful for family, he's obviously grateful for his twin, he's grateful for love. You know, life is short.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're all dying every day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But mainly the boots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grateful for Percy and for Whitestone and for having a place she can call home. I know. And for, you know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm 'gramming it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For Vax being back. And even for, you know, she's grateful for the time that they have. Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can't answer in 500 voices at once.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Well, that's why we're here. Do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'd be very Lovecraftian if I did that all of a sudden, you heard 500 voices come out. All of your minds shatter together as one.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: No one would be surprised. All right, all right. Who's next? Thank you, that was a great question.

lines.name: TRAVIS, BRIAN
lines.text: I like your ears.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Travis likes them, too. Hey, what's your name?

lines.name: TREVOR
lines.text: My name's Trevor. First, I want to thank you all for the hours of entertainment and the inspiration. You guys are awesome. My question is, the playlists are awesome. Will we ever see guest playlists?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh. Hey, y'all want to do some guest playlists? Yeah, sure.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Okay, we got some thumbs up, all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Legitimately hadn't thought of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tova slow-jazz.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is a song, I Want a New Duck.

lines.name: NOELLE
lines.text: (offscreen) --something by "Bear" Naked Ladies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Bear"naked Ladies. Nice. (sings) It's been--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no. I see who this is.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, hey, what's up? What's up? Oh, shit! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He just ran 480 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was gone so fast!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Turns out you can go that many feet that fast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, what you got?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What you got for us, Ray?

lines.name: KRISTINA
lines.text: Hi. So my name's Kristina.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hi, Kristina.

lines.name: KRISTINA
lines.text: So you're currently dealing with an arc of gods and those ascending to godhood. Say somehow that happens to your Vox Machina characters. What would they be the guardians of the domains of, essentially? What would they be the gods of?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And all will worship me! So great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to see Bacchus Grog now, only wearing a grape leaf.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Curse your name every time it rains.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Basically turn into Storm. Everyone's least favorite X-Man. No, that's arranged for Dazzler, probably, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You wound me. No, I think he would definitely-- there's a history of machinist gods, the gods of order and making things happen the way they're supposed to, so he would definitely go that direction.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Blah-blah-blah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If there's a god of aerated wine, then I'd be that. God of grapes and aerated wine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gunning for your job, girl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What, you'd be the raven--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it's on now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Duke it out, right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right now! Arm wrestle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After the panel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. The goddess of commerce, or-- (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Commerce?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All things sparkly?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: The god of commerce? Sounds badass. I wouldn't mess with the god of commerce.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The small business association god?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pretty much. Her temple would be where you drop off your gold at, you know what I mean?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: She'd cut you with a deposit slip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The god of naps and free time.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Amen. Great question. Great outfit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We do deal in fantasy, Matt.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hey, what's your name? Nice shirt!

lines.name: MICHAEL
lines.text: Thank you. My name's Michael, I saw you at the Magic Castle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to see you again.

lines.name: MICHAEL
lines.text: So my question is, I know you have a live show coming up at Gen Con. I was wondering if you guys have any plans to do a live show on the West Coast? (cheering)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good question, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're, you know, shows are a big undertaking, and trying to get the logistics worked out are always difficult, both within locations and scheduling everything. We'd definitely like to do more live shows, so if we manage to put something together for that in the future, we will be happy to announce it and eagerly throw it in your face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like we could go, play a short game, and then Hava Nagila. I don't know. Something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Life is short, kids. Happy Sweet 16.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, we'll keep you posted. We'll keep you posted. By the way, Gil the Blogsmith over here, ladies and gentlemen, in the green. Stand up, Gil, let people give you some love.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stand up, Gil, Jesus!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Stand up, for god's sake! There we go. Look at that beautiful, beautiful man. Okay, who's up next?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's more reveals, Brian.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh, there are. Hold on one sec, we have another big-- we'll leak a couple more out as we go here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (grunts) (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Laura has also decided to give away all of her possessions and only own dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could probably build a house from them, so. It's fine.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Okay, who's next?

lines.name: VAUGHAN
lines.text: Hi, my name is Vaughan. This question is for Matt, but I'd like the rest to answer, including Brian "Cabbage" Foster.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: That's a good one. Format it however you want.

lines.name: VAUGHAN
lines.text: What is your favorite 16-bit JRPG?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 16-bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With, like, a little bit of Earthbound creeping up there. But I'm probably going to have to say Final Fantasy VI to me. But it's a tough one. Just barely because the story goes a little bit darker and intense in the third act. Not that Lobos wasn't intense.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It has to be 16-bit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I think you're forgetting about the amazing 16-bit JRPG Jurassic Park. I love that one, on the Gameboy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The ones in arcades where you got in it? That was a great game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was a PC gamer during that time, and so I was King's Quest and Quest for Glory, so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bloop-bloop-bloop.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pass?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was a Phantasy Star 2 kid. That was really my jam. That was a weird, weird game, and the sci-fi vibe was--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was Secret of Mana 16-bit, or was that 8-bit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it was 16-bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Light applause, light applause.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Travis? Oh. Terranigma? Or Evo? Anybody play Evo? Search for Evolve? Search to Evolve? Search of Evolve?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings) Thank you for your question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got a Laura song.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Manleth! (cheering)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: What's your real name?

lines.name: MILES
lines.text: Hi, my name is Miles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MILES
lines.text: Critical Role has kind of inspired the other RPG shows on the Geek & Sundry format, so I was wondering how Vox Machina would react if they were to plane shift to Vulcana, for instance. From Titansgrave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Electricity would be really interesting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think Keyleth would be like, "I knew it!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so delighted by this entire notion that I can't think straight. Oh my god, D&D crossovers, what a crazy idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we jump into Shield of Tomorrow and do a Star Trek crossover?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would love to do a Star Trek crossover. I've got to admit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm into that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Look at all the Shield of Tomorrow people going, bring it on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (knocks) What are you doing in there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One more minute!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've always wondered about the holodeck in that way, because--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just because they don't put it in the episodes doesn't mean it doesn't happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It has to happen, right? You have an entire crew of people that are like, (hums).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That room must be so nasty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! Maybe they have a secondary holodeck, you know what I mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm not going to Dungeon Master your holodeck experiences, guys. I'm sorry. I got close enough with an audiobook once, and that was weird in its own right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to see Vox Machina skinned into cyberpunk, I think.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's actually Valkana!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they would all get along with Lemley so well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was an awesome question.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you so much, Manleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm aware.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Once again... never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just because Vax has never pooped in an episode of Critical Role and you haven't seen it, doesn't mean it doesn't happen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vex doesn't poop. I'm just putting that out there. She never poops. Ever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: #Vaxdoesntpoop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Do you eat?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! How are you going to have a Heroes' Feast?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll find out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next question.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Yeah, we've got to move on or we're going to get spoilery.

lines.name: AUDIENCEMEMBER
lines.text: So the rest did enough questions, so super nerdy inquiry to Matt about old school D&D. Since you've introduced the current arc and you start going to the upper planes of the gods, pretty much all I can think about is the final AD&D book: Die, Vecna, Die. It's an essential story about him, and I'm wondering-- I've been going through the campaign book and looking at your pantheon and so forth, and have you considered the stuff from those old stories in regards to the Serpent and Lady of Pain and Sigil and the stuff above the gods, if you have that figured out and those cosmology and whether it will come out either in this campaign or eventually. I assume they fight Tharizdun in the next campaign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Especially now that we're releasing campaign guides and this has become a world now that we can bring to you guys to play in, I have to be careful to not pull in too much of the very licensed D&D lore. Otherwise, we would have to reskin everything and you all are like, "oh wait, which "one's which? Oh no." I'm trying to keep that to a minimum. But if you know a lot about Vecna--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then tell us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then don't tell them anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell us his weaknesses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't listen to her...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the perfect time to segue into our next Comic-Con announcement though, which is in season three, we are converting to first edition D&D.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The characters will die before you get artwork done.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Hey, what's your name?

lines.name: SEAN
lines.text: Hi. My name is Sean.

lines.name: MATT, MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Hi, Sean!

lines.name: SEAN
lines.text: Hi. I actually saw Matt first in front of me for the ThunderCats panel in this room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah! Oh, way back then! Oh man.

lines.name: SEAN
lines.text: My question is actually related to that. How much Critical Role's grown over the years. I'm sure none of you expected it to grow to this type of audience, and I still remember the days when you were reading all the donations, even on stream. Do any of you miss anything from those early days when it was still such a small show?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I liked eating fried chicken on set.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like we can't go through all the fanart-- we do, but after the after-show reactions and responses, we can't really go through it as much anymore.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was much easier. We're getting to a point we're like-- whoa.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Excuse me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the one thing I miss. Oh, five minutes a week. I can deal with this.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Does anyone miss shooting in a three-year-old child's bedroom?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was pretty. I liked it.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Me, too. I was just wondering.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The race car bed was

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry, what am I supposed to do at level 16?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Exactly what you're doing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some clown scared a family! Things get a little heavy in the later levels, but we'll get back to the carefree feeling probably in the next campaign.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Great question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For me, I guess what I miss a little bit is the anonymity to go into the Dealers' Hall. But other than that, I wouldn't change anything. This is amazing.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Put on Ivan's demogorgon outfit and wander the floor and nobody will know it's you!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could put on a mask.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, now I can't do

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: I might have not thought that through all the way, he said to a microphone. Thank you for the question, though. You're awesome. You're great. Hey, what's up? All right, we're going to have to lightning-round this because we've got about seven minutes left, so go ahead.

lines.name: MC
lines.text: What has surprised you about all of your guys' character developments, and I guess for Matt, the world developments, that have come up over the past few years?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For me? Surprised that people want to play there and everything's been reactionary. Creating the campaign guide was reactionary. That wasn't our idea. Green Ronin came to us; they were like, "You want to do a campaign guide?" Okay. So we're amazed that people have interest in them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Um...

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Skip her!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I'm surprised that she is willing to take responsibility for more than just herself and her brother and her bear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Never thought that Vax would get dark as he has. It ties into the last question. I thought, we were like a couple of Han Solo characters for our entire home campaign, at the beginning of the campaign and would never have predicted that it would be so freaking serious. Ever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I was surprised that Taryon lasted longer than two episodes. And... that's it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think most recently, I'm surprised I didn't realise Pike would ever be able to have wings. That's pretty good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was expecting Percy to end a terrible mess, and it somehow has not happened. He's actually kind of a functional human being, which was not the plan, ever.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Literally smeared on broken rocks. That was shocking. I'll pick that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was not in your vision.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This one's for Keyleth! (thuds)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That happened, right?

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Thank you. Who's up next?

lines.name: MIKELYN
lines.text: Hi guys! My name is Mikelyn. I was wondering, Matt, what scenario were you most proud of throwing at the group, or what is your favorite kind of scenario to throw at them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Timed scenarios. D&D is a lot of planning and arguing and trying to figure things out, and there's game time versus planning time, and I love a scenario where I can tell the players, "well, "you have this much time to do both. Go." It ups the intensity, so I love me my hourglasses, definitely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stupid rakshasa.

lines.name: MIKELYN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Next question. What's your name?

lines.name: ALEX
lines.text: Hi, I'm Alex. Thank you Ashley for Gortys, because she's the most adorable character ever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's pretty great.

lines.name: ALEX
lines.text: Thank you Laura for Lucina, because she is the best. And Matt, what time is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man! Almost got through a panel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: ALEX
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Panels, Mexican restaurants, the dentist's office...

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Anywhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: All right. Go ahead, man. What's your name?

lines.name: ALEX
lines.text: As a fellow DM, Matt, if you're able to tell us, for the next campaign, it's going to be chronologically after this current timeline or is it going to be before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the next campaign I'm planning to be roughly 20 or so years beyond the end of this campaign. And it's going to be in a different continent, and there's a possibility, depending on which characters and NPCs survive this final arc, they'll be existing somewhere in the world.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we could visit ourselves if we live?! (yells) Oh man! That's so cool!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reveal!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I remember your great-great-grandfather, Trunket. Oh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Trinket babies! Oh no, Tova, you have to come back! (laughter)

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Oh my god. What a sentence!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next question.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: Okay, we've got time for one more. It's up to you.

lines.name: AUDIENCEMEMBER
lines.text: I can't get through a game of Monopoly with my wife without going to bed angry. How do you guys deal with it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I push him out the window at the Taco Bell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Seriously, calm down Taco Bells, definitely after an intense session. Like driving, scratch the knee. You want Taco Bell? (mopey voice) Yes. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's insane because we live ten, 15 minutes from you guys and we do the same shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have our own Taco Bell. I'm like, "why did you take my Deck of Many Things, Laura?!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like for us, at the end of the game, for Matt, he's like, (sighs) "Done for the "week!" And I'm just getting revved up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Why did you ever get the thought it was me going, "Oh. Done for the week." It's me going, "I'm sorry. It's what the story did."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the Raven Queen's deal? Is she to be "trusted? I don't know." And he's like--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just talking to a brick wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he'll go, "Ugh!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's going to fold one of these times.

lines.name: BRIAN
lines.text: We'll see you guys. Thank you so much! Thank you!
